intro: Chaenorhinum persicum, commonly known as Persian toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces clusters of yellow or orange flowers with four petals, which are often arranged in racemes. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats.
